page.title: 10REIGATE NATURAL HISTORY CLUB
page.content: The Holmesdale{Natural History {Club,}founded in 1857, now has a membership of over 200. The original aim of studying Natural History has been widened to include Archaeology, Local History and Ornithology in the Reigate/Redhill area. Micklefield School pupils saw some of the interesting exhibits the Club has collected on a visit in May to the small, privately owned{museum}at l4, Croydon Rd, Reigate. The Natural History section includes stuffed birds (eagles, owls, paradise birds & sparrows), fish, fossils & insects. Old postcards, maps and slides vividly illustrate{local history. Exhibits, many from excavations in which Club members have participated, include the skeleton of a young Saxon girl, medieval drain pipes, and pottery associated with witchcraft.
